Authors: Handoko B.L., Riantono I.E., Gani E.
Title: Importance and benefit of application of governance risk and compliance principle
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Handoko, B.L., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Riantono, I.E., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Gani, E., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Today the concept of governance risk and compliance (GRC) has become a necessity, however, in its implementation; there are still many GRC companies that consider it a burden. Our research aims to broaden the insights of businesspeople, regarding how to integrate and manage the benefits of implementing governance risk and compliance. The research method in this research is qualitative research. We use primary data from interviews with informants, besides that we also use secondary data in the form of published research papers and reports related to GRC. The results show that if the company is able to implement GRC effectively, it will have an impact on the company, including being able to predict and analyze possible risks in the future. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Compliance; Enterprise; Governance; Management; Regulation; Risk
References: Alisjahbana, A. S., Busch, J. Authors: Meiryani, Amri M.A., Sudrajat J., Riantono I.E.
Title: The effect of financial target and financial stability on fraudulent financial statements
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Binus Entrepreneuship Center, Management Departement, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Amri, M.A., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sudrajat, J., Binus Entrepreneuship Center, Management Departement, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Riantono, I.E., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to analyze fraudulent financial statements with fraud pentagon on mining sector public listed company, calculated using fraud score model. This study used secondary data from official website of Indonesian Stock Exchange. Samples were selected by purposive sampling method. The analytical method used in this observation is regression data panel analysis using Eviews 10 software. The results of this study indicate that Financial Target effect on fraudulent financial statements. Meanwhile Financial Stability no effect on fraudulent financial statement. © 2019 by Advance Scientific Research. This is an open-access article under the CC BY license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/)
Author Keywords: Financial Stability; Financial Statement; Financial Target; Fraud
Funding Text 1: This work is supported by Research Technological Transfer Office (RTTO) BINUS University 2020 funding, as a part of Research Grant of Penelitian Internasional Binus (PIB)/ International Binus Research (PIB) entitled “Quality of Accounting Information Systems and Their Emerging Contributions of Public Listed Companies”.

Authors: Widuri R., Handoko B.L., Riantono I.E.
Title: Perception of Accounting Student on Learning of Generalized Audit Software
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Widuri, R., Accounting Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Handoko, B.L., Accounting Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Riantono, I.E., Accounting Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to measure the students' acceptance of audit software (Audit Command Language) in the process of financial audits. This study uses statistical approach to test hypothesis. Researchers distributed questionnaires to the active students majoring in Accounting and Finance, enrolling a course of Method and Practice of Computerized Auditing. This study tested the hypothesis between variables by using path analysis. The independent variables are Perceived Ease of Use (PEU) and Perceived Usefulness (PU), the intervening variable is Attitude Towards (ATT), and the Intention to Use (ITU) as a dependent variable. Result of this study shows that PU positively influences ATT but has no influence on ITU. PEU positively influences ATT and PEU has no influence on ITU. ATT positively influences ITU. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: generalized audit software; learning; perception; students
Index Keywords: Information management; Regression analysis; Sensory perception; Surveys; Dependent variables; Independent variables; Intention to use; learning; Path analysis; Perceived ease of use; Perceived usefulness; Statistical approach; Students

Authors: Inayati T., Riantono I.E., Tjoe T.F.
Title: Inclusion of information and communication technology to msmes strategic planning in Indonesia
Source title: International Journal of Recent Technology and Engineering
Affiliations: Entrepreneurship Department, BINUS Bandung School of Creative Technology, Bandung, Indonesia; Economics and Communication Department, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Inayati, T., Entrepreneurship Department, BINUS Bandung School of Creative Technology, Bandung, Indonesia; Riantono, I.E., Economics and Communication Department, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Tjoe, T.F., Entrepreneurship Department, BINUS Bandung School of Creative Technology, Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) have become one sector in Indonesia that are important for economic development. However, the system for MSMEs are unknown and unconstructed, especially with the development of information and communication technology that affect the sustainability and productivity of MSMEs. Therefore, this study’s first objective is to build a model that contains MSMEs model in macroscopic view with the involvement of ICT to enhance income for MSMEs. Second objective is to determine what recommendations should be given to raise the economic development received from MSMEs involvement according to the model. The results are a causal loop model is built based on previous researches about MSMEs that combine factors and important elements in the system. Based on the diagram, there are three recommendations given to the Government: trainings to MSMEs about ICT for their businesses, continuing to apply tax reduction for MSMEs, and enhancing their market shares by internalization process. © BEIESP.
Author Keywords: ICT; MSMEs; Strategic policies; System dynamics
